meanings.definition: To place or store in a bin.
meanings.sent1: She was binning her toys after playing.
meanings.sent2: He is binning the groceries in the pantry.
meanings.sent3: The cat was binning its toys all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The students were binning their books neatly on the shelves.
meanings.sent5: Binning the tools in the toolbox made them easy to find.

meanings.definition: The act of discarding or disposing of something.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the binning of trash was necessary.
meanings.sent2: Proper binning of old items can help declutter your space.
meanings.sent3: The binning of expired food items was a smelly task.
meanings.sent4: The binning of broken toys made room for new ones.
meanings.sent5: Effective binning of papers can help in organizing your desk.

meanings.definition: The process of grouping data into bins for analysis.
meanings.sent1: In statistics, binning is important for data analysis.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use binning to simplify complex data sets.
meanings.sent3: The binning of information helped in drawing meaningful conclusions.
meanings.sent4: Binning data into categories makes it easier to interpret.
meanings.sent5: The accuracy of the analysis depended on proper binning of the data.
